Description: Arm dagger made of iron, blade leaf-shaped, handle of hard wood, oval in section, silver wire and ornamented silver bosses.
Curator's comments: Registered without any place of acquisition, but given as part of a collection made by the donor in Upper Egypt and the Sudan. A slip written later (probably in the 1870s) attributed the knife to the Nile-Congo watershed, possibly in the Welle (Uele) district. Colonel Leake cannot ever have been in that area, though it is possible that it had been traded northwards.
Acquisition notes: See comment on the first object in this group, Af1853,0422.1.
